Added switch for different login api error states, handling different messaging for different error groups. Attempting to use displayError() now as well.

* Adds 'state' attribute to the login form fields
* Adds corresponding css for when login form fields are in 'error' state
* Moves error messages for login errors to message file
* Highlights username/password field on error
* Uses displayError() function for login errors
* Updates login-failed message to be more generic

* Change popup dialog to not use textarea nor include default 'failure-details' message. * displayError() now populates dialog HTML inside

tags * added popup-ok message The only places I see displayError() currently used is in handling failure cases for image uploads, and the two areas I've implemented for login failures. I'm not sure what impact these changes will have on image upload failures - I suspect the 'failure-details' message was intended to help wiht the upload failures. If that's the case, perhaps it can be prepended to the error message prior to display only in that use case, rather than ubiquitously as it seemed gratuitous for login failure cases, and I suspect it will be overkill for many other uses of displayError() in the future.

timeout a geolocation request

it seems in airplane mode the error callback is never called
so we should set a timeout so this gives up looking after some time
(20s for the time being - random choice of number)

note allowing the user to 'go back' is problematic as the request could
still succeed and the callback might fire after the cancel. Pretty sure you
cannot cancel a getCurrentPosition request but may be wrong.

show upload progress

starts at 0
after first edit token request goes to 10
during file transfer the progress bar moves from 10 to 60
after second request edit token request jumps to 70
then every 500ms we add 1 to fake the POST request
on completion goes to 100%

getting creative with copy text

the old copy text didn't fit with the progress bar. This works better
imo

Updates campaign info generation and scheme to use full campaign data from API
* Modifies python script to capture full campaign data rather than limited subset

* Updates campaigns-data.js to latest full campaign data
* Campaign data structure now made up of keyed objects, campaign name is key

* Campaign sorting by alpha now happens in the template
* upload.js now required in app.js
* updated formatUploadDescription() to specs in bug 38282
* Adds specific categories per bug 38286, with the exception of UA, which will be dealt with later.

Adds android version and device as category to photoupload

Adds template support for photo upload description

upload.js

should not get cached.

ensure that history never repeats itself
basically what this does is ensure that if a pattern A B A B occurs
in the history the repeated pages are thrown away

e.g. given path D E D E A B A B A B C will become
D E A B C

this prevents ridiculously long back button behaviour when rapidly
toggling between screens
